I forgot about plastic free July!
.
Please excuse my manky bath matt. One of the easiest plastic free swaps for me was ditching the face wipes and cotton pads. 
.
In our house we no longer have kitchen roll, face wipes or cotton pads. Confession time, I have 1 travel sized pack of pads for nail varnish remover, but once I buy more pads I think I will keep my older ones for that. Everything is reusable. I got these adorable patterns from @turtley_eco y(you'll notice most of my plastic free stuff comes from there.)
.
I love it when I wash everything and pop them all on the washing line, it looks like bunting. The pads come with a little bag that you pop them in and tie and pop in the washing machine. Honestly I feel so much better and less wasteful using these. Also, face wipes are no good for your face either! Stop using them now and save for emergencies! 
.
#ecofriendly #platicsucks #plasticfreeswaps #plasticefreejuly #eco #savetheplanet #savetheturtles #plasticfree #ecofriendlyproducts #turtleyeco

With the deadlines approaching to rapidly reduce emissions, it is clear that the children of today will not live in a carbon intensive world when theyâ€™re older. They simply canâ€™t afford too. To keep warming below 1.5 degrees above pre-industrial levels, a person born today can only emit one eighth of lifetime emissions compared to someone born in 1950.â 
â 
To keep warming below 1.5 degrees, which is considered to be the threshold before the climate really starts to wreak havoc, global emissions need to peak this year, 2020. Emissions then have to fall around 50% by 2030 and to below zero by 2055. This scenario requires a huge amount of negative emissions being deployed (afforestation, technology etc.). However, many countries are not doing enough to see these targets met so children born today may need to emit even less than this new study suggests.â 
â 
However, as this study by Carbon Brief points out, every country has a different carbon footprint and therefore individual emissions over their lifetime are hard to make blanket statements for. For example, someone from India only emits 1.9 tonnes of co2 per year on average, however this number is 16.9 for someone from the United States. And to continue on from that, countries such as the UK and the USA have much larger historical emissions than many other nations.â 
â 
Hopefully richer nations and people who have benefited from a lifestyle and system that caused the climate crisis will begin to show strong leadership. Hence why it is so important that we all continue to make sure we elect governments that will act on climate, not give massive bailouts to the fossil fuel industry.â 
â 
Help us reach more people so we can make sure that everyone can make informed decisions about climate change moving forward, please share our posts and page!â 
â 
Source; Carbon Briefâ 
â

Eype Beach - Friday 24th July. Day 5. The vids. Started off light and happy. Ended with confusion and frustration. 
It's the first time today that we have both felt pretty emotional. The videos don't do it justice. We picked up more broken glass today then we ever have, and we simply couldn't get it all. It's upsetting to know that you tried your hardest to get all the shards but couldn't. There were 100s. Fingers crossed a bird or child doesn't walk across it. ğŸ˜¢

I was shocked to find out that "on average, litter pickers recorded 4.8 pieces of period waste for every 100M of beach. This equates to almost two million items when mapped against the UK coastline". Sourced from @natracare (who can I please add- produce quality organic, plastic-free and biodegradable period products ğŸ‘Œ).

Flushing pads and tampons down the toilet is compromising our environment and endangering our wildlife. They should always be disposed of in an appropriate bin.

However, even when being disposabled of correctly  disposable plastic menstrual products will end up in landfill and will take approximately 500 years to break down! ğŸ˜¥

As terrible as this is, there is good news! There are so many alternative menstrual products out there now which are more sustainable and eco-friendly. Avaliable online and some in supermarkets. 

Not only that, they can be better for your body with the lack of plastic ingredients being present and *kerching*... reusable products can save you money!ğŸ’°

âœ… Menstrual sea sponges

âœ… Leak-proof period clothing
âœ… Biodegradable and plastic-free disposable period products

An apple a day keeps the doctor away. This saying has a scientific background: An apple combines many vitamins and minerals, especially vitamin C and potassium are comparatively high. It is also rich in fiber pectin - this is important for good digestion and a long-lasting feeling of satiety. The contained flavonoids (phytochemicals) have a positive effect on the immune system and can be anti-inflammatory. An apple also consists of around 85 percent water - making it relatively low in calories. By the way: Most vitamins are in the shell or directly below.â â €

DOMINION is an Australian documentary released in 2018 by #ChrisDelforce. The film shows the many ways in which animals are regularly abused. A total of six facets are illuminated: farm animals, wild animals, companion animals, entertainment animals, fur animals, and animal experimentation.
-
Dominion uses drones, hidden and handheld cameras to expose the dark underbelly of modern animal agriculture, questioning the morality and validity of humankindâ€™s dominion over the animal kingdom. While mainly focusing on animals used for food, it also explores other ways animals are exploited and abused by humans, including clothing, entertainment and research.
-
Narrated by #JoaquinPhoenix, #RooneyMara, #Sia, #SadieSink and #KatVonD, and co-produced by #Earthlings creator #ShaunMonson. Filmed in #Australia, with a global message.

Below the surface - Containers.

Part 6 of my series with @sarah.robertson.barnes , going beyond the simple swaps to underlying issues and next steps.

Leftovers, packed lunches, take-out, delivery. When we think of these things, we donâ€™t see the food, instead itâ€™s the containers! 

Although some containers are reusable (still plastic), and some are recyclable, containers still have the potential to end up in landfills. Recycling programs vary by municipality, and there is never a guarantee that what you throw in the blue bin will be recycled properly, or recycled at all. Even cardboard recycling is overburdened by the online shopping industry!

Below the surface, recycling can oftentimes end up in landfills. And landfills in Canada tend to be near communities of colour or Indigenous communities, compromising peopleâ€™s health with toxic waterways, poor air quality and garbage. Internationally, wealthy countries ship garbage and/or recycling to developing countries. 

Both of these examples are a form of environmental racism: with little other economic opportunity, less wealthy communities take the brunt of citiesâ€™ excessive waste. As a result, many urbanites are also detached from where their garbage goes, therefore producing more and more garbage without personal consequence. 

The change is in your actions: Make use of your space and the items in your house or apartment. Containers previously used for food, like a pickle jar, can continue being used for food in the fridge OR freezer (yes- jars can be frozen- just donâ€™t fill liquids to the top!). A sour cream container could become a seedling container. Cardboard boxes can be stored for future use/storage. If you have a need, look around first: what do I have that can be repurposed? 

You can also take action by shopping mindfully. When you are making purchases, remember that youâ€™re paying for the packaging as well as its content: can it be reused in some way? 

Bigger picture, the issue of landfill locations undermining community health is also an issue of under-representation in local politics. Whose voices are being left out of the conversation?

Ik ben Else Marij. Na mijn studie aan de HBO-V ben ik gaan werken als @kinderverpleegkundige_wakz Daar is de interesse ontstaan voor de unieke en veerkrachtige band tussen ouder&kind; om deze te ondersteunen in tijden waarin zorgen zijn. De stappen erna (kinderthuiszorg, @centrumvoorjeugdengezin_ en werken in een huis voor kinderen met ernstige trauma en hechting problematiek) kwamen voort uit het verlangen om iets te betekenen in die ouder&kind relatie. 

Van mijn veertig levensjaren (hiep _hoera; dit jaar!) ken ik al ruim dertig jaar Jantine. Het samen starten van kinderpraktijk @villa_hoep was een stap die dankbaar logisch voelde. 
En dertig jaar iemand kennen of net een jaar; dat maakt soms geen verschil. In de ontmoeting met Saskia van @rouwloods is er een bijzonder inspirerende samenwerking ontstaan. 

...met plezier blijven we ons ontwikkelen in ons aanbod voor gezinnen, scholen en organisaties. Onze bespreekmomenten doen we met fijne taartjes, eindeloze afwegingen en blije, trotse hoeraâ€™s! 

Ik gun het gezinnen, instellingen en scholen dat ze het gesprek over de dood kunnen hebben binnen een veilige omgeving. Met misschien een lach, een traan, met creativiteit en alle verlegenheid die je soms kunt hebben. Misschien wel met een taartje ;-)

Ik ben moeder van drie, getrouwde met Jaap, en om ons heen huppelt hulphond Vos. (Klinkt dat niet idyllisch) Een dynamisch gezin maakt mij dankbaar; _een zelfgeplukte bloem in een vaasje, _kikkerdril op de salontafel in mijn leuke kringloopschaal (brrr), _chaos in huis vanwege creatieve kinderen vol ideeeÌˆn, en _stille momentjes helemaal alleen. Rust vindt ik bij God die onvoorwaardelijk van mij houdt. 
Zouden omstandigheden die soms ingewikkeld zijn je wellicht dankbaar maken!? Zo ervaar ik het wel. Dankbaar voor mijn gezin, dankbaar dat wij met @torisdood een verschil kunnen maken!

Hi everyone, I apologize for being slightly quiet during plastic free July! 

I just wanted to talk about how little changes are just as significant as a complete shift in lifestyle.

I was looking at nuts in the reduced section and spotted some heavily packaged snack boxes which I was tempted to purchase. I then noticed these lower down and favoured them instantly. I often keep my eyes peeled for things like this, a mindset that comes with time. 

It's okay if you are feeling overwhelmed during this time and purchase things wrapped in plastic. We are all doing our best. Just consider moments like this a win and be proud of the progress you are making.

Conventional cleaning products can contain some very strong chemicals â€“Â including some harmful ones. Common chemicals in cleaners have been linked to a range of human health harm, from reproductive problems like fertility issues and birth defects, hormone disruption, breast cancer, asthma and other respiratory problems, and allergies.
The kicker is that cleaning product companies arenâ€™t required by law to list all the ingredients in their cleaners, so people havenâ€™t even had the information they neededÂ to try to figure out which ones are safer. Thatâ€™s begun to change recently thanks to the work of groups like Womenâ€™s Voices for the Earth. Unfortunately, most companies are still keeping fragrance ingredients a secret, where toxic chemicals like phthalates, musks, and styrene can lurk.

Many people don't understand the idea of minimalism. They think if they can't get rid of a certain object they can't be minimalists. However, the idea of minimalism is not to get rid of all your stuff and see how you can live with little left. But instead to ensure that all things in your home, in your life have a certain value from having. That is why minimalism will always mean a different thing for every person. What you find valuable might not be for another person. Minimalism is not about what you own, it is about why you own it.

A word from designer/founder Sindhu:
When I was a kid, my Mum ran a successful business selling sarees, bed linen and fabrics. Who knew it would inspire Adult Me to start my own label?!
.
After discovering the unspoken problems within the fashion industry and the impact it was having (and still has) on the environment, I wanted to throw my two cents in.
.
So, inspired by my passion for fashion and running a business, I created Manu The Label - a slow fashion brand for those who love to live mindfully.â€
.
Manu The Label is a slow fashion clothing label, creating clean and minimalist pieces made from hemp. Manufacturing predominantly in-house by hand, they produce in small runs, rather than mass-producing each product.

Their Caterpillars eat the leaves and then find fallen leaves or holes in hollowed plant stalks to spend the winter in hibernation.  Nectar sources for adult butterflies include a great variety of flowers including dogbane, swamp milkweed, shepherd's needle, asters, and winter cress. Theyâ€™re not picky! â£
â£

2020 has taught us that you can make milk out of practically anything ğŸ¥› There are so many options on the market now including those above, as well as coconut, pea, hemp, flax, cashew, walnut, and more!
â €
But why make alternatives to regular milk? Turns out, dairy has a high impact on the environment. Raising a cow for milk requires vast land, constant electricity, thousands of gallons of water and grain â€“ and even more water and pesticides are required to grow grain. Moreover, cows create huge amounts of greenhouse gases through their burps and feces (weâ€™re not kidding), which pollute not only the air but waterways, too.
â €
Not all plant milk is perfect. One glass of almond milk, for example, requires more water than a typical shower â€“ still less than a glass of cowâ€™s milk! But almond farming practices like monocropping and heavy pesticide use have shown to be really harmful to bees. While some alternatives have their drawbacks, there are still so many environmental benefits of choosing one of the lower impact options.
â €

Youâ€™ve probably heard or read or noticed that ever since the COVID-19 shutdown, the air and water all around the planet has gotten cleaner. Yes, nature is rebounding around the world.

Communities across the country have seen examples of increased litter during the coronavirus pandemic -- especially masks and gloves discarded on the ground -- and environmentalists are concerned the increased use of single-use products like masks, gloves, bags and disposable silverware will lead to more plastic waste making its way into the ocean.

The good news are some countries are trying to make some changes in ordee to reduce plastic waste during this pandemic period.France is looking to increase littering fines to combat pollution amid the pandemic. The European Commission is pressing on with its single-use plastics ban despite pressure from lobbyists. And in Australia, an ask for residents to go plastic-free in July.

Starting from the lone peak point of the journey//
This is just a piece of scenery that we witnessed, watching it dance with the everchanging sun rays. They were bringing different rock formations to life, giving the cliff a new face over and over again.
 Sunlight changed from misty yellow to fiery pink in a matter of minutes. We sat on the cliff absorbing the view that was so vast and captivating that our brains just weren't able to comprehend all that visual information. 
  The sunset reminded me of the Restaurant at the End of the Universe (by Douglas Adams) which time turbines slowly rock backward and forward across the crucial moment.
 The guests of the restaurant get to see the end of the world whenever they come, and given the intensity of the experience, I felt like that was exactly what we were witnessing - the sun was colliding with the horizon, the day was withering away - but the world was unfolding. It was a potent, vulnerable moment.
.
.
.
It took some time for the moment to sink in and integrate into my very being. I am saddened by what we're doing to the world (and ourselves). The more I love it, the more every piece of junk, mindlessly thrown, hurts me. How do you deal with a problem so extensive, and with so much to lose? #nature #sunset #ecology #savetheearth #climate #education #ecofriendly #environment #eco #zerowaste #climatechange #ecologie #savetheplanet #biology #green #wildlife #conservation #biodiversity #naturephotography #sustainability #earth #photography #plasticfree #recycle #gogreen #naturelovers #sustainable #pollution #noplastic #bhfyp

We're so excited to announce our partnership with @loststock_, ensuring no clothes are left unloved ğŸ’š

Lost Stock are not only preventing tons of clothes from ending up in landfill, but supporting thousands of garment workers in Bangladesh left without pay due to brands cancelling orders. We're still fighting for these brands to #PayUp (check our stories to see who's still on the list!), and are partnering with Lost Stock to ensure these beautiful clothes stay out of landfill and live a happy life.

If you receive an item in your Lost Stock bag that might not be the right fit or is potentially not quite your style, you have the opportunity to swap and share these with other Lost Stock users via the Nuw app! When you swap something, you'll earn a token to grab another piece that you will love ğŸ˜

READ #ANTARCTICA2020 

Sign the petition. Link in bio

This year, we can secure the largest act of ocean protection in history.

2020 marks the 200th anniversary of the discovery of Antarctica. It is also the year when the highest temperatures ever were recorded on the continent. With melting ice, warming waters, and increased fishing, all of the creatures that live there need us more than ever. But we need Antarctica just as much. This vast icy continent is critical to stabilizing our climate, and it circulates vital ocean nutrients that sustain fish populations, and humans, all over the world.

Did you know that 111 is seen as a lucky number in India? Or that female babies are seen as a financial burden upon families, especially those in poorer regions?
Since 2016, this small Indian village found a way to celebrate newborn girls by planting 111 trees for each female baby born; supporting the communityâ€™s ecological and economical future and fighting against historical female prejudice as they go.
ğŸŒ´ğŸŒ³ğŸŒ²Why trees?ğŸŒ³ğŸŒ²
The trees provide food, energy, and income to the 8,000 residents of Piplantri and help them to achieve long-term economic and environmental sustainability. Plants also filter the air and help contribute to a higher water level and richer wildlife. Whatâ€™s more, the Piplantri people started planting aloe vera next to the trees because it works as a natural pesticide, and this subsequently enabled them to start selling products made of the aloe plant like juice and gel, among other things.
This town is just incredible and so forward thinking (theyâ€™re doing way more than just the tree thing - would definitely recommend checking the full story out via @brightside.official!)

Big Bad Wolf
24x36 in
Acrylic on Canvas
2020

Inspired by the story of â€œThe three little pigs,â€ the artist came up with this artwork titled â€œBig Bad Wolf.â€ This childhood story tells us that in life you must give your fullest when you do something. Laziness is something that should never be honed and adapted because youâ€™ll never know when accidents and tragedies come. Just like what weâ€™re experiencing today, the pandemic had caused numerous hardships towards plenty of individuals including artists. Plenty of opportunities had been lost and the struggle towards advancement became harder. However this doesnâ€™t mean that you must let it be without doing any work. No matter how huge and strong bad instances come, we must keep on striving and persevering. Just like how the story went, weâ€™ll only find the best awards when we know weâ€™ve given our all.

FOR & ABOUT SENSITIVE PEOPLE
.
Sometimes I feel like writing and sharing something personal, I donâ€™t know why it comes but I follow
. Today  I felt overwhelmed looking at Instagram so much information, political madness and happy photos of food that it seems my brain canâ€™t comprehend anymore. I literally feel nauseous looking at the screen of tv and now at the screen of my phone too. Itâ€™s too much to comprehend for one brain, the range of emotions triggered by posts is crazy- from laugh to cry and back. ğŸ˜«
Iâ€™m very sensitive and emotional, I cry at movies, I cry a lot, if someone is crying- Iâ€™ll cry, if someone feels sad Iâ€™ll cry; Iâ€™m happy myself like most of the time but all the pain and injustice around give me actual pain and with age it seems Iâ€™ve learnt to control it better but the depth of emotion is getting more intense. To all my sensitive brothers and sisters, I know itâ€™s a blessing and a curse to feel so much and so deep, but that what makes us closer to others, that what makes us willing to help, to be more aware. 
Sometimes I wish to feel less, for example I physically feel ill in the places with bad vibes, I feel dizzy and nauseous and it come like an alarm for my consciousness that I have to stay alert and protect myself. Itâ€™s very uncomfortable to be honest but itâ€™s also makes me choose people around me and places to stay wisely. 
ğŸŒ…
I have many friends who are the same, very sensitive, and I love them for being reflections of whatâ€™s going on, I love them for being so careful around people cause they actually feel everyone around. Sometimes we might seem rude cause we have to keep boundaries high around toxic people, cause we feel their pain physically even if itâ€™s covered by big smile. Its  actually painful to look in the eyes of toxic people, to see the darkness, to see the longing for love and I wish to be able to give all that love, all that love that they are seeking and even more, but sometimes I have to stand up, turn away and walk away very fast and probably lock myself in the room and cry to release your pain.
And maybe itâ€™s our function - function of highly sensitive people - to take this pain from those who carry it and cry it out!â¡

PuÃ², il batter d'ali di una farfalla in Brasile, provocare un tornado in Texas?". Spesso ci avete chiesto cos'Ã¨ questo effetto farfalla, anche negli incontri che abbiamo fatto nelle scuole. L'effetto farfalla Ã¨ l'idea secondo cui piccole variazioni nelleÂ condizioni inizialiÂ producano grandi variazioni nel comportamento a lungo termine di unÂ sistema. Cosa vuol dire? Per usare la metafora della farfalla: il battito di ali di una farfalla in Brasile sposterebbe le piccole molecole di aria intorno a sÃ© e questa piccola variazione, con un effetto a catena sulle molecole di aria via via piÃ¹ distanti, potrebbe causare una grossa variazione in Texas, come un tornado. Cosa c'entra con il clima magari vi state chiedendo? La conseguenza pratica dell'effetto farfalla Ã¨ che iÂ sistemi complessi, come ilÂ clima, sono molto difficili da prevedere su una scala di tempo utile. Questo perchÃ© ogni modello che tenti diÂ simulareÂ un sistema deve necessariamente eliminare alcuneÂ informazioniÂ sulle condizioni iniziali, e qui torniamo ad esempio alla nostra farfalla: quando si simula il tempo atmosferico, non Ã¨ possibile includere anche lo spostamento d'aria causato da ogni singola farfalla. In conclusione quindi, l'effetto farfalla viene utilizzato come metafora per far capire a tutti quanto sia complesso lo studio dei fenomeni climatici.

Today Iâ€™m thinking about the wellbeing of the planet. Itâ€™s â€œPlastic Free Julyâ€ so I thought Iâ€™d share a couple of the ways I minimise plastic use.

Iâ€™m always on the lookout for new ideas and shops/suppliers that support the plastic-free initiative, so please do let me know if you have any good tips or know of any good zero waste shops/products/suppliers.

Firstly, a really easy oneâ€¦ rather than buying new handpump bottles of soap each time they run out, I buy an eco-refill from the supermarket. This example from Carex uses 75% less plastic than the original bottle. Itâ€™s a no brainer â€“ it takes less than a minute to empty one of these refils into an existing soap dispenser.

My second tip, and Iâ€™ve used these for a few years now, is beeswax and cotton food wraps, which I use instead of clingfilm. They are washable, biodegradable and they have the benefit of having the natural anti-bacterial properties of beeswax, which will help keep your food fresh. I simply use the warmth of my hands to make the wrap more malleable, secure the wrap over the top of a bowl, or wrap it directly around food. And then as the wrap cools, it holds its shape and creates a seal. You canâ€™t expose these wraps to hot temperatures or put them in the microwave - nor should you use them on raw meat or fish - but for everything else â€“ superb! And then you can use cold water and a mild detergent to wash them/wipe them down after use.

What have you been using in place of unnecessary plastics?

Should I care about choosing environmentally friendly painted products including environmentally friendly furniture? ğŸŒ VOCâ€™s, or volatile organic compounds, are compounds that easily become vapors or gasses and are emitted from many of the everyday household cleaners & paints available on the market today & that many of us buy.  Breathing them in affects our health so it IS good to be aware and use the available research in our buying decisions.

An excerpt from Time magazine 2019 explains: â€œExperts are still figuring out just how these chemicals harm the human body. But research has found that some of them can be absorbed into the blood through contact with the skin or through inhalation, and that they can accumulate in the brain or organs of those who are exposed. The liver also breaks down some of these chemicals into byproducts that can bind to and potentially interfere with a cellâ€™s genetic material.

The take-home message from all this research is that paint is potentially toxicâ€”especially for â€œvulnerableâ€ groups such as pregnant women, young children and the elderly. VOC levels are usually much higher indoors than out, especially if those indoor areas are not well ventilated. And wet or drying paintâ€”particularly oil-based paintsâ€”tend to emit a lot of VOCs, says Clifford Weisel, a professor at the Environmental and Occupational Health Sciences Institute of Rutgers Universityâ€. 

VOCâ€™s are found in:
Paints and thinners
Adhesives
Hobby and craft supplies
Dry cleaning fluids
Glues
Wood preservatives
Cleaners and disinfectants
Moth repellants
Air fresheners
Building materials and furnishings
Copy machines and printers

Furniture you buy from Condover Furniture Ltd based in Condover, just outside of Shrewsbury, Shropshire, and shipping nationwide, uses only top quality environmentally friendly primers & paints and Osmo waxes & oils which leave an environmentally friendly finish.

We also upcycle quality wooden furniture so prolonging the life of existing products and saving landfill.

In addition a percentage of the purchase price benefits charity.

Aloe Ever-Shield by Forever Living is a completely natural deodorant, free of aluminum compounds and other chemicals harmful to health. Its main ingredient is aloe vera. The action of aloe vera is multidirectional, it not only allows you to get rid of the bad smell, but also soothes the skin irritated by epilation.
The action of aloe is based on the alleviation of excessive sweating of the skin and the reduction of the multiplication of bacteria feeding on sweat.

This product can be used even immediately after depilation of the armpits, because the aloe contained in the composition soothes irritated skin, softens it and brings relief. Forever Aloe Stick protects clothing against unsightly stains, both on light and dark clothes.

Our deodorant is recommended also by oncology clinic in London.
Message me for more details how to join Forever or to get yours.

We came up with the idea of You Do You â€“ Eco from our own eco journey, which I found confusing.â 
.â 
I felt like Alice falling down the rabbit hole. I wanted to try everything that might help, but products can often be expensive. Where to start? Why this one over that one? I joined Facebook groups and at first felt I wouldnâ€™t be able to be as eco as other people were being. As they were doing it better than me, would my contribution make a difference? â 
.â 
They made me feel guilty that I couldnâ€™t afford to change my whole way of life in one switch. That is when I came up with the idea of You Do You - Eco. It is more about doing what you can, when you can and not to feel guilty about the fact you can only afford to change small things each month or even every other month. â 
.â 
A thousand people being eco imperfectly, is so much better than ten people being eco perfectly. Is there even a perfect way to do anything. No, as my perfect is different from your perfect!! You do you and be proud of who you are! We want to empower you to feel great about your decisions and the way you live your life. ğŸŒğŸ’šâ 
.â

Ok, hands up who has ever forgotten their reusable shopping bag when they pop to the shops?? I know I've forgotten literally dozens of times.
Simple plastic free swap? Lots of supermarkets will have a supply of cardboard boxes if you need to transport your shopping, if they aren't readily available you can always ask. Or if you have a trolley full, unload it straight into the boot of your car, you will also find this takes up way less space than bags (from someone with a teeny tiny car this can be a huge help!)

Apply to become a Tunza #Eco-generation Regional Ambassador Program - 

Tunza Eco-generation is the social networking platform to be an interactive and vibrant site presenting various possibilities to engage children, youth, and environmental organizations from around the world. Their primary purpose is to serve as a global platform for #environmental #education and networking for young people.

Eco-generation Regional Ambassador is an elite position awarded to the youth aged between 13 and 24 qualified to represent Tunza Eco-generation, an environmental networking platform for children and youth around the world. Eco-generation Regional Ambassador Program provides exceptional experiences with the opportunities to actively plan, to execute or participate in various environmental awareness programs in each region and country.

Benefits:
Improvement of personal environmental #leadership skills.
Enhancement of promotions for oneâ€™s organization and (or) environmental awareness programs.
Online mentoring provided by mentors to their Ambassador Reports.
A certificate that verifies successful completion of the Ambassadorâ€™s duties. #environment #youth #sdg #2030

Apakah ini masa depan yang kita inginkan? ğŸ˜±

Para ahli memperkirakan, lima tahun lagi, atau pada tahun 2025, rasio plastik dibanding ikan di samudra akan menjadi 1:3. 

Lalu pada tahun 2050, karena plastik akan terakumulasi terus dan terus di laut, akan ada lebih banyak plastik dibandingkan ikan. Kita akan berenang bersama sampah plastik. Literally.

Laporan dari Credit Suisse menyimpulkan seperti ini: "bobot dan volume plastik di lautan akan melebihi total volume seluruh ikan pada 2050."

Mungkin banyak di antara kita yang sudah tidak akan ada lagi pada tahun 2050. Tapi bagaimana dengan anak cucu kita dan generasi-generasi sesudahnya?

ğŸ‡Sparkling RoseÌ Aperol Spritz Granita Cocktail ğŸ‡

INGREDIENTS (makes 4 cocktails)

Â¾ cup passion fruit juice
Â¼ cup Aperol
4 teaspoons sugar
2 cups Santa Margherita Sparkling RoseÌ

DIRECTIONS

Add all ingredients into an 8 x 5 glass or metal bread pan, stir well and place in the freezer overnight. Using an ice cream scoop, carefully scoop out granita mixture and place into a coupe. Add an extra splash of Sparkling RoseÌ for extra effervescence, then garnish with passion fruit and edible flowers.

Bueno MGF Peptide Serum
Serum vitalitas ini mengandung 50% EGF Complex. Bueno MGF Peptide Serum telah di sertifikasi oleh Badan Makanan dan Obat-Obatan dapat memperbaiki kerutan pada kulit kering karna mengandung Adenosine.

Kandungannya

Peptide
Peptide adalah Bio-Material dengan keamanan tinggi yang sangat baik dalam menghilangkan keriput, Melembabkan kulit, Memperbaiki kulit yang rusak dan melindunginya.Peptide mempunyai partikel yang kecil yang dapat menembus jauh ke dalam kulit yang sangat efektif untuk memperbaiki kulit.

Adenosine 
Adenosine Berfungsi sebagai Anti-Imflamasi dan memperbaiki kerutan. Mencegah penuaan pada kulit dengan mensintesis protein dan kolagen di dalam kulit serta meningkatkan kekuatan pada kulit. Adenosine juga memiliki fungsi untuk menyembuhkan jerawat dan masalah kulit berminyak.

Hey Everyone, So today's post is all about Sustainable Living. Back in February, I set myself a challenge and did #Ecofeb2020. I made one sustainable change each day for the month of February, and it actually went really well. I was quite surprised if I'm honest. The only challenge I found I couldn't keep up was shopping only at farmers' markets. From an economic point of view, I just couldn't afford it every week, but I am hoping that I can visit  @milkmarketlimerick at least once a month, now that it has reopened. 
_
My little challenge was what actually inspired me to set my website. I have created a category called sustainable living. To me, to live sustainably means that I consider environmental aspects, economic stability, and social factors such as ethics when making decisions. Meatless Monday, supporting local business, and choosing to only drink ethically sources coffee. Sustainable living means I have a fulfilled life all while being conscious of the long term goal for our planet.I have a blog post entitled; How to Live a Sustainable Lifestyle where I shared my experience of #Ecofeb2020. The link is in my Bio if interested in having read. 
_
The second picture represents what sustainable living means to me, as it is such a  personal thing, I would love to know what does it mean to you?

Bueno MGF Peptide Serum
Serum vitalitas ini mengandung 50% EGF Complex. Bueno MGF Peptide Serum telah di sertifikasi oleh Badan Makanan dan Obat-Obatan dapat memperbaiki kerutan pada kulit kering karna mengandung Adenosine.

Kandungannya

Peptide
Peptide adalah Bio-Material dengan keamanan tinggi yang sangat baik dalam menghilangkan keriput, Melembabkan kulit, Memperbaiki kulit yang rusak dan melindunginya.Peptide mempunyai partikel yang kecil yang dapat menembus jauh ke dalam kulit yang sangat efektif untuk memperbaiki kulit.

Adenosine 
Adenosine Berfungsi sebagai Anti-Imflamasi dan memperbaiki kerutan. Mencegah penuaan pada kulit dengan mensintesis protein dan kolagen di dalam kulit serta meningkatkan kekuatan pada kulit. Adenosine juga memiliki fungsi untuk menyembuhkan jerawat dan masalah kulit berminyak.

NEWSFLASH- UK Research and Innovation has just awarded Â£3 million to support six research networks, including one at Cambridge, that will investigate solutions to air pollution.

The funding will support multidisciplinary research networks that will address future air quality challenges at the indoor-outdoor interface.

Poor air quality is the largest environmental risk to public health in the UK, according to DEFRAâ€™s Clean Air Strategy. The new multidisciplinary networks will drive forward research and innovation to help tackle major air quality challenges within both indoor and outdoor spaces including home, school, work, and public transport.

The topics will include: exposure to airborne biological material; urban and building ventilation design; air quality impacts of decarbonisation and low emission transport; and protection for groups most at risk, including designing healthy schools.

Decarbonisation and the drive to net zero suggest future scenarios where road traffic pollution is reduced, new buildings become increasingly sealed for energy efficiency, and people spend more time indoors as they work and study at home using technology to stay connected. This will increase the importance and influence of indoor air pollution on outdoor air quality, and vice versa, and on our health.

Magic & logic in business
Personally, I am a very strategic person with "strong logical reasoning skills", as an assessment showed when I wanted to find out which course of studies to persue. My intention was to find out if I possessed #creative talent. They couldnÂ´t find any. OMG, can you imagine?
So I chose physics and I know now what I had done. After my father had died in a car crash on the way to one of the building sites he oversaw at the time, I fled into my head, distanced myself from the ache in my heart.
Today, I feel a lot of compassion for the little girl I was. She was only 10 years old, my artist child, as I have come to call her. She holds the key to my inspiration and creativity.
Today, I have come full circle. I love to fully use my logical mind when I manage an #architectural project AND I also have my heart white open and access to my creativity when designing.
Magic & logic is how I create and how my line of #handbags came about, as a creative exercise on my way back to #wholeheartedness (thank you BrenÃ© Brown).
The bags have structure AND amazing colours to brighten your business-day. I created them with so much love, attention to detail AND they are so soft to touch.
Which is yur favourite?

Becoming more climate friendly is not about radically changing your entire life overnight.

Itâ€™s about slowly learning and gradually taking more and more steps which are good for both you and the planet. Itâ€™s about self love and personal development, and this is a slow process â¤ï¸

Could you become better at investing your money in something that is good and productive for you instead of buying more things? 
Could you perhaps explore your own country or the neighbouring countries instead of flying half across the world? 
Could you use your bicycle or public transportation more instead of the car? Or could you change the car to an electric one?
Could you use Ecosia more than Google?
Could you teach your kids about nature? 
Could you buy more local? 
Could you take better care of your body and eat greener? 
Could you do with less materialism and have more freedom?
Could you learn to love yourself and life itself? Could you learn to love all life on this planet and do more good? 
Could you give more than you took?

Yesterday I was so upset that I had to direct my anger towards something creative. Why I was angry? I had a row with my husband about my yesterday's post!(which I probably remove, but only because other people on IG put my exact thoughts out there much better than I ever could). I don't won't to be quiet, I wanted to use this small platform to talk about issues that bother me, I am not here to please anyone.

Anyhow, I made yesterday those hessian scrubbies out of old coffee bag (coffee was a gift from a friend from Brazil) and I used my son's old trousers (cut into pieces of course) as a filler (organic cotton, thank you). Trousers were repaired many times around the knees, they are now too small and too worn to pass to my nephew. So I made shorts out of them (because they still fit around my son's skinny bum) and I have dish scrubbies/sponges. It's a win-winğŸ˜ğŸ‰ğŸ†.
I was inspired by one of the accounts I follow to do it myself, it looked easy the way they made it (I need to find this account, will let you know). I wanted a scrubbie badly, but refused to buy new, because of my minimalist approach, but this is something I really missed, especially for narrow neck cups and wine glasses. I couldn't clean glasses properly with a brush and I can't fit some glasses into dishwasher. Problem solved ğŸ¤“
Scrubbies are washable and I believe they might be compostable, definitely can go to garden waste.

P. S. You can use them to scrub off inequity, patriarchy and social inequality but that is a tough task.

~

#FunFactFriday 

Plastic pollutionÂ is the accumulation ofÂ plasticÂ objects and particles (e.g.Â plastic bottles,Â bagsÂ andÂ microbeads) in the Earth'sÂ environmentÂ that adversely affectsÂ wildlife,Â wildlife habitat, andÂ humans.[1][2]Â Plastics that act asÂ pollutantsÂ are categorized into micro-, meso-, or macro debris, based on size.[3]Â Plastics are inexpensive and durable, and as a result levels of plastic production by humans are high.[4]Â However, the chemical structure of most plastics renders them resistant to many natural processes ofÂ degradationÂ and as a result they are slow to degrade.[5]Â Together, these two factors have led to a high prominence of plasticÂ pollutionÂ in the environment .

#FunFactFriday 

Plastic pollutionÂ is the accumulation ofÂ plasticÂ objects and particles (e.g.Â plastic bottles,Â bagsÂ andÂ microbeads) in the Earth'sÂ environmentÂ that adversely affectsÂ wildlife,Â wildlife habitat, andÂ humans.[1][2]Â Plastics that act asÂ pollutantsÂ are categorized into micro-, meso-, or macro debris, based on size.[3]Â Plastics are inexpensive and durable, and as a result levels of plastic production by humans are high.[4]Â However, the chemical structure of most plastics renders them resistant to many natural processes ofÂ degradationÂ and as a result they are slow to degrade.[5]Â Together, these two factors have led to a high prominence of plasticÂ pollutionÂ in the environment .

Billions of searches are made around the world per day.
Switching to a more eco-friendly search engine is an easy way for you make a difference without having to even move.
Search engines make massive amounts of money. So using an app such as Ecosia or OceanHero will help this money to go towards helping our planet.

Ecosia - A search made using ecosia helps the planet by planting trees. This helps fight climate change, remove CO2 from the air, restore landscapes, protect wildlife and provide nutrition, employment + education to people who need it. This leads to healthier, happier and more economically stable communities. Ecosia also owns and operates its own solar plant, so your searches are powered by renewable energy.

OceanHero - Searches made using OceanHero help support solving the problem of plastic pollution of the oceans. Every time you use the Ocean Hero search engine, they use 50% of profits to help stop plastic entering the oceans.

We hope that our tips will show you how easy it is to take care of the planet with your lifestyle. We hope you enjoy our page. ğŸŒğŸŒ±

Maaltijdsalade van rode bietjes en makreelğŸ˜â 
â 
Wat heb je nodig? (4 personen)â 
-500 gram gekookte rode bietâ 
-2 gestoomde makreelfilets â 
-2 sjalotten, gesnipperdâ 
-1 eetlepel grove mosterdâ 
-1 eetlepel witte wijnazijnâ 
-5 eetlepels olijfolieâ 
-versgemalen peper en zoutâ 
-2 zoetzure augurken, grof gehaktâ 
-75 gram rucolaâ 
â 
Bereidingswijzeâ 
1. Ontvel de bieten indien nodig en schaaf ze in dunne plakjes.â 
2. Verdeel het visvlees in kleine stukjes. â 
3. Klop een dressing van de sjalot, de mosterd, de azijn, de olie en peper en zout naar smaak. â 
4. Leg de plakjes biet op een grote platte schaal en verdeel de vis, de augurk en de rucola erover. Lepel de dressing erover en zet tot gebruik in de koelkast of serveer direct. â 
â

Andy Goldsworthy, Rowan Leaves Laid Around A Hole, 
1987

Much of Goldsworthyâ€™s land art is transient and ephemeral, leading many to view it as a comment on the Earthâ€™s fragility. But for Goldsworthy, the picture is more complicated.
â€œWhen I make something, in a field, street or altering the landscape, it may vanish, but itâ€™s part of the history of those places,â€ he says in another interview. â€œIn the early days, my work was about collapse and decay. Now some of the changes that occur are too beautiful to be described as simply decay. At Folkestone, I got up early one morning ahead of an incoming tide and covered a boulder in poppy petals. It was calm, and the sea slowly and gently washed away the petals, stripping the boulder and creating splashes of red in the sea. The harbor from which many troops left for war was in the background.â€

24th July 2020.

The day wearing a face covering in a shop became mandatory (unless you have medical exemption. Or apparently are in Asda or Tesco because they donâ€™t seem to care).

I wear my mask for you. 

I wear it because I could be asymptomatic and I want to help protect those who are vulnerable. 

I wear it because I donâ€™t want to be the reason someone is ventilated.

I wear it because going to the supermarket on my own in the evening is like a spa break at the moment and Iâ€™d like to continue doing that.

I do it because my husband will divorce me if the Amazon man turns up again so it means I can physically go to the shops I need things from.

Yes, it gets hot. Yes, it feels weird. Yes, I worry Buddy will be sad not to see smiling faces when in a shop. But I think I prefer it to a ventilator. 

Please stop asking the government to spoon feed you - if you are able to wear it inside (eg you arenâ€™t eating or drinking) in a public place, then just assume you should be wearing it. Common sense please people, letâ€™s protect the more vulnerable among us.

Iâ€™ve seen enough of hospitals in the last year, I donâ€™t fancy seeing another high dependency bed...

BREAK UP WITH SINGLE USE PLASTIC. 
Share this on and pledge to #breakupwithplastic
----------------------------------------------------

Sometimes our relationship with plastics can feel very complicated. On the one hand we think about all the advancements plastic has brought us in modern society. We convince ourself of all of the apparent benefits and then shrug off any uncomfortable realities that don't align with the one we have created. But this is a luxury that many people, primarily in the West, can only afford.

We ship away our plastics rather than deal with the reality of what we have created. We ship them to developing countries to poison their bodies and air. 

Single use plastic is a plague in our society. The pollution generated from the lifecycle of plastic, from extracting the raw materials to the end of its life in landfills, oceans and the incinerator, disproportionately damages the lives of black, indigenous and people of colour. 

Single use plastic doesn't just harm wildlife, it kills people. 
Reduce your consumption of single use plastic and send a clear message to Big Plastic and its allies.

Making cashew milk! ğŸ¥›ğŸ¥›
Swipe right to see the process and me squeezing the nut milk bag ğŸ˜‰ğŸ˜‰ 
There are two ways to do it...
 ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³The easier way is add 2 tbsp cashew butter to 2 cups water & blend. Depending on your blender this will probably have a bit of fibre in it and so probably not the best for hot drinks, but perfect for baking, porridge etc. You could probably strain it through a nut milk bag to get the bits out. 
ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³The high grade way! Soak 1 cup of cashews in water for at least 3 hours (or overnight in fridge). Drain & rinse well. Add to blender along with 4 cups of water, a date (optional) & a pinch of salt. Blend well, pour into a nut milk bag and squeeze out the milk (lol). You'll get about 1litre of milk and some "cashew pulp". You can use the pulp to make biscuits, hummus, crackers & other things! 
ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ”§Have you tried making your own milk?? Let me know how it went in comments!

Has anyone else been wearing less make up? Thereâ€™s nothing like having no plans to make you revise your make up routine. 
.
Iâ€™ve worn make up since I was a teen... concealer, foundation, mascara, eyeliner, eye brow pencil... then eye shadow, lip liner and blusher. 
.
I donâ€™t think thereâ€™s anything wrong with wearing make up. Itâ€™s anyoneâ€™s choice, which they shouldnâ€™t be shamed for. For me, I never felt good about myself without wearing it.
.
Iâ€™ve had periods of acne and bad skin, which contributes to the cycle of feeling bad about yourself. And in the past when Iâ€™ve had mentally low points, I couldnâ€™t muster up the energy to take my make up off at night, which again adds to the cycle of bad skin. 
.
Iâ€™ve always silently wished that I could be one of those people who didnâ€™t feel like they had to wear a full face of make up, and didnâ€™t care what people thought of them.
.
So, for all of these reasons itâ€™s been nice to frequently be wearing NO make up. Itâ€™s also given me the opportunity to start liking my face, which Iâ€™m not sure Iâ€™ve ever done before.
.
It has also been helpful that my sweet boyfriend regularly reminds me that he loves and prefers how I look with no make up (which blows my mind!). He says it so genuinely that I believe heâ€™s not just saying that! 
.
This isnâ€™t me saying never again will I wear a drop of make up! Iâ€™m going out for lunch and will probably wear mascara and concealer. Instead, itâ€™s me saying that I like how I look both with and without make up, and maybe Iâ€™ll do more of the latter. 
.
Iâ€™ve even had days where Iâ€™ve not looked in the mirror, and I love that because it means Iâ€™m not obsessing about what I look like. 
.
Iâ€™m also looking forward to exploring #plasticfree make up options, which I havenâ€™t done yet because Iâ€™m using up what I have, which is a lot!
.

 It is shocking to see helplessly dead animals suffering from human indifference.

 We are responsible for these disasters.
 We are the ones who throw the waste into the sea and we are the ones who cause the deaths of so many animals.

 What can we do?
 Avoid bringing plastic to the beaches and throwing the garbage on our beach.  Simple and life-saving.

We are all surrounded by nature. Nature changes constantly and we as humans are making more changes to it based on our lifestyle. There will be no natural resources without the balance in nature. But are we doing our part in saving Mother Nature?

Reasons why we need to save nature

1.We can reduce the water shortage by taking preventive measures. A number of countries are facing a water shortage today.
2.Saving nature can help get rid of food shortage as well.
3.We can reduce the ill effects of pollution by planting more trees.
4.Surrounded by nature helps reduce stress, which is common with people who lead a sedentary lifestyle.
5.All humans and other living being are protected by nature, and the consequences can be bad if we try and tamper it.
6.By saving nature, we can make sure that all the planetâ€™s inhabitants have the needed supply of water and air.
7.Oxygen is produced by trees and cutting them can show an impact on human health.
So, nature is important and let us not destroy it!

One of the reasons some parents don't give cloth a go is the extra washing. However, cloth nappies only add an extra load every two to three days. One argument used against cloth is this extra washing. However, the electricity and water used to wash nappies doesn't compare to the amount of water and energy which is actually used to create and dispose of disposable nappies. Not to mention the other benefits of reducing waste and saving money. Each child will use between 4000 to 6000 disposable nappies as opposed to around 30 resuable ones with cloth ğŸŒ¿

In the last part of our Plastic Free July blog series, we want to talk about coffee cups.â 
â 
Not only do most cafes use plastic lids, the disposable cups themselves are lined with plastic polyethylene, which is tightly bonded to the paper. This lining is what enables the cups to hold liquid. It is also one of the reasons why the cups are difficult to recycle, combined with the fact that they are contaminated with drink.â 
â 
To find out more about what reusable options are available instead of #singleuse cups, read part 3 of our #PlasticFreeJuly blog series on ecobella.co.uk.â

Las tres erres (3R) es una regla para cuidar el medio ambiente, especÃ­ficamente para reducir el volumen de residuos o basura generada. En pocas palabras, las 3R ayudan a tirar menos basura, a ahorrar y a ser un consumidor mÃ¡s responsable. Y lo mejor de todo es que es muy fÃ¡cil de seguir: reducir, reutilizar y reciclar.

Reducir: Debemos tratar de reducir o simplificar el consumo de los productos directos, o sea, todos aquellos que se compran y se consumen, ya que tienen una relaciÃ³n directa con los desperdicios. Por ejemplo, en vez de comprar 6 latas pequeÃ±as de una bebida, compra dos botellas grandes, tendrÃ¡s el mismo producto pero habrÃ¡s generado menos basura.

Reutilizar: Nos estamos refiriendo a poder volver a utilizar las cosas. A darles la mayor utilidad posible antes de que llegue la hora de deshacernos de ellas. Y asÃ­, disminuir el volumen de basura. CLIMATARIAN? Apakah sama dengan Vegetarian?

Pada umumnya seorang #climatarian, menghindari memakan daging dan bahan pangan yang memiliki jejak karbon yang tinggi.

Seorang climatarian berbeda dengan seorang vegetarian, karena seorang climatarian bisa menolak buah atau sayuran impor yang lebih tinggi jejak karbonnya dibandingkan buah dan sayuran lokal. 

Seorang climatarian bukan berarti menjadi seorang yang anti makan daging, tetapi lebih mawas dengan pilihan makanan yang mengandung jejak karbon tinggi. Seorang climatarian tahu bedanya jejak karbon yang dihasilkan peternakan ayam vs peternakan sapi, dan mengetahui jika daging sapi menghasilkan jejak karbon yang lebih besar daripada emisi bahan bakar fosil.

Apakah kamu seorang #climatarian atau kenal seorang #climatarian? Tag orangnya yuk!
Gambar dari https://experiencelife.com/ dan https://www.meatfreemondays.com/tuck-first-climatarian-week/

Itâ€™s the 19th century in Great Britain. Fear of witchcraft and enchantment is at large. To protect yourself, you snap a few twigs off the rowan tree. Perhaps the tree with its vicious red berries may help let you live another day.

Rowan (Sorbus aucuparia) is a native European tree, with a fascinating mystical history. Rowans are easily identifiable by its distinctive pinnate, which comprises of 5-8 individual leaflets. Rowans also produce scarlet berries that can be cultivated into delicious jam. Itâ€™s tough wood has also been used for woodworking.

Often found at high altitudes, rowan is also known by its other name, the mountain ash. You can find this tree on a hike up the highlands of Scotland or on a stroll down a high street.

If the translation of rowanâ€™s old Celtic name â€œfid na ndruadâ€ (=wizardsâ€™ tree) does not allude to its historical mythical association, then I donâ€™t know what does. Because the colour red was believed to ward off evil spirits, rowans were widely planted outside houses to protect people from witches. In Scotland, it is an act of taboo to cut down a rowan tree!

Day 24 #PlasticFreeJuly 
#reducereuserecycle is today's #setmeplasticfree prompt
This gives me the perfect opportunity to show off my new "recycling hub", as it's been lovingly named here.
Not only is it perfect for sorting all my different recycling streams (our local council is rubbish at recycling and it's very limited in what plastics it will take) but it was made using the old decking we took up in the garden (by my husband,  not me, I did not inherit any woodworking genes from dad)! It isn't quite finished but is already doing an awesome job for all my boxes. And yes I do have a box for "good jars" as that's who I am now ğŸ˜‚
He also whipped up a bike ramp/jump for the kids!
He might not be able to put on a load of washing but he has his uses ğŸ˜

A new COVID-19 outbreak has occurred in the administrative center of the Xinjiang Uighur Autonomous Region. A "wartime stateâ€ has officially been declared in the city of Urumqi. No new cases had been detected in Xinjiang over the last five months. The situation is complicated as the territory of the Autonomous region contains the infamous "re-education camps" (Xinjiang re-education camps), where Chinese citizens who profess Islam (mainly ethnic Uighurs) are detained by force. International human rights organizations classify these institutions as Chinese counterparts of Nazi concentration camps. For example, a video from Xinjiang, which shows hundreds of prisoners with their hands tied behind their backs and black bandages covering their eyes, caused a significant negative response. Should the virus gets into these camps, it is unlikely that they will be able to avoid a mass spread of the infection.

Vegan-friendly sneaker brand Veja has opened has opened its first test hub to clean, repair and recycle its old shoes, with the last option only being used when shoes are beyond saving. 

The site is located in a former military barracks on the Quai des Queyries in Bordeaux, which also hosts an urban farm and a skate park.

The brand stated its initiative is in support of its belief in the principles of the circular economy by minimising waste wherever possible, though it is not yet known how it will scale up its efforts to become a standard in-store service.

These recycling numbers that you see are used to categorise plastics. 

1) PETE - Poly(Ethylene Terephthalate)

2) HDPE - High Density Polyethylene

3) V - Poly (Vinyl Chloride)

4) LDPE - Low Density Polyethylene

5) PP - Polypropylene

6) PS - Polystyrene

7) OTHER - these include a combination of 1-6 or another less commonly used plastics

Biodegradable plastics are not recyclable and hence are given the number 7 which means they're included in other plastics category.

Tag someone who should know this!

500,000 animals suffer and die worldwide every year in cosmetics tests.
Animals are still suffering and dying to test shampoo, mascara and other cosmetic products. Terrified rabbits, rats, guinea pigs and mice have substances forced down their throats, dripped into their eyes or smeared onto their skin before they are killed.

Animals used in cosmetics testing are suffering needlessly, as cosmetics companies can already create great products using thousands of available ingredients that have a history of safe use and do not require any new testing. Modern methods combine human cell-based tests and sophisticated computer models to deliver human-relevant results at less cost and in less time than animal tests.

Switch to cruelty free certified brands for your favourite products. It s time to END all tests on animals.

This is a term used commonly when discussing future sustainable developments. 
Keeping more live stock, cutting down forests and producing fossil fuels are just some of the sources of increased carbon in our atmosphere, contributing to the greenhouse affect, causing rising sea levels, poor air quality and the destruction of natural habitats. 
Over the last 250 years we have released 40% more CO2 into the atmosphere, with the highest levels recorded in 2018. 
Do you know what materials you are consuming daily, how those materials are made and what their end of life process is? Understanding and educating ourselves now could help to save our future plant.

Our indigenous ancestors used fire to manage the land. And we carry on the tradition of our original Wurundjeri owners of this land, but now using flame torches, or flamers, in the vineyard and around the farm. Flamers allow us to eliminate reliance on chemicals, and don't result in groundwater contamination or chemical residues on crops. Olifantsgras groeit snel, heeft nauwelijks water nodig en kan bijna overal groeien. Het absorbeert vier keer meer CO2Â dan een Europees bos. Een duurzaam gewas dus. Olifantsgras bevat veel cellulose, perfect voor het maken van allerlei duurzame materialen. Vibers produceerde eerst papier, vervolgens bio-beton en uiteindelijk bioplastics en werd al snel genomineerd voor de Top 100 meest innovatieve MKB-bedrijven in Nederland.

Why Seed Pensâ€¦ because 12-15 lakhs plastic pens are thrown every day in India itself. And if you consider 8-10gm of plastic each it's a very huge pollutant.
Recycled paper pens, a great alternative to plastic pens as they are made from 100% recycled paper and contain seeds that can grow into veggie plants.
They come in a set of 10 with a cloth pouch are a must have for your office and home.

This no-lid, foldable paper cup could help to eliminate plastic lids.
.
This cleverly-designed no-lid, foldable cup is called the @unocuptogo, and itâ€™s intended to reduce plastic waste by offering coffee and tea drinkers a convenient and eco-friendly way of fueling up on the go. Unocupâ€™s sleek, well-tested folding design comes with its own built-in lid as an integrated top.
.â €
The creators of the Unocup wanted to create a product that is easy to fold, hold, drink from, and reopen. Its design was made to create less spillage and offer a more sturdy hold. The Unocup would eliminate the worry of a plastic lid popping off or the lid separating from the cup if held from the top.â €
.
While pollution from plastic straws has gotten a lot of buzz, plastic lids reportedly make up to eight times more of ocean waste than straws do! Unocupâ€™s inventors note that out of an estimated 4 million coffee lids per day, NYC alone uses about 1.5 billion lids a year â€“ enough to create a trail of lids 3.5X the length of Earthâ€™s circumference.

Meet @rhea.soulsbyphillips and @phillipsdave83

These two wonderful people are in the middle of their #7beaches challenge.

Raising funds for Clean Jurassic Coast, Rhea and Dave are doing 7 beach cleans in 7 days.

There is a link to their Just Giving page in our bio.

Although CJC isn't a registered charity, we are a non profit organisation and we still need financial help with the day-to-day running costs and also for our future plans of world domination. I mean, plans to educate the public via school groups and local businesses, pay for equipment and other resources, clear the Jurassic Coast of plastic and other litter and, in basic terms, keep our beautiful World Heritage Site in good condition.

The Jurassic Coast is the only natural World Heritage Site in England. It must be protected and cared for. It should be enjoyed by many as it is the only place on the planet where the Triassic, Jurassic and Cretaceous periods are all in one area and we, the CJC team of volunteers, pledge to look after it.

Thank you Rhea and Dave, I know you've seen some horrid things this last few days but your perseverance is exemplary!

Thank you to all our volunteers,  supporters and and everyone who has donated thus far.

See you on a beach soon!

Reposting from: â€¢ @zeroxplastic â€œAbout one third of all food produced worldwide is thrown away or lost in the food supply chain. Can you imagine? ğŸ¤¯ It takes so much time and resources to grow food and then we throw away one third of it. Crazy! But it's not only the production where a lot of food gets lost, an average citizen of the EU and the USA wastes about 95-115 kg of food every year!â 
â 
Here are some tips to avoid food waste:â 
- Have a look into your fridge before grocery shopping.â 
-Make a list of things you need and then only buy those.â 
-Store your food correctly and use all parts of your fruits and veggies.â 
-Trust your senses instead the best-before-date.â 
-Eat leftovers the next day, freeze or share them ğŸ™Œâ

~Plastic-free July~

Day 24. Quinoa Milk has a very earthy milk taste. Adding sweetness & some cinnamon really makes it taste awesome. It's a great milk for warm oats in the morning â›… 

What you need
1 cup cooked quinoa (240 grams)
3 cups water (750 milliliters)
4 dates
1/4 tsp cinnamon

Steps
Blend the quinoa with the water until well blended and almost smooth.
Strain the blended quinoa mixture using a nut milk bag.
Pour the quinoa milk in a blender and blend with the dates and cinnamon.
Store jars in the fridge for 3 or 4 days.
